com.jaunt

Class UserAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaunt.UserAgent

  • public class UserAgent
extends Object
    Represents a lightweight, headless browser for XML, XHTML and XML documents. When the UserAgent loads an HTML or XML page, it represents it as a Document object. The Document object exposes the content through a tree-like document object model (DOM). The DOM consists of Nodes, such as Element objects, Text objects, and Comment objects. HTML documents, for example, begin with the <html> Element, who's child nodes are <head> and <body> Elements. Each Element contains zero or more attributes (such as <body id='main'>) and zero or more children. The children can be Text objects, Comment objects, or other Element Objects.
    Since:
    0.9.0
    Author:
    Tom Cervenka

      Downloads and saves the content at the specified url as the specified File, overwriting the file if it already exists; this method does not invoke the parser, and therefore UserAgent.doc is set to an empty Document; UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse.

      Returns the current cache or null if no cache is set.

      UserAgent setCache(Cache cache)
      Sets the specified cache; the cache must be enabled before being used.
      UserAgent setCacheEnabled(boolean enable)
      Turns on/off caching, which causes HTML/XHTML source retrieved by HTTP GET request to be stored in the cache and pulled from that cache for any subsequent GET requests to the same url, as long as caching is enabled; by default, caching is handled by the FileSystemCache, which stores files in a directory called "jaunt_cache", which is in the directory specified by UserAgentSettings.outputPath.
      UserAgent setFilter(FilterCallback filter)
      Sets the specified filter.
      UserAgent setHandler(String contentType, Handler handler)
      Sets the content handler for the specified contentType; the Handler receives callbacks to handle the content rather than having it handled by the parser.
      UserAgent setProxyHost(String proxyHost)
      Sets or clears the ip address of the http proxy.
      UserAgent setProxyPort(int proxyPort)
      Sets the port number of the http proxy to be used.
      UserAgent setReferer(String referer)
      Sets the value of the referer header in the next HTTP request.
      Document visit(String url)
      Directs the UserAgent to visit the specified url (ie, sends an HTTP GET request); UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).
      Document visit(String url, int redirectCount)

        Turns on/off caching, which causes HTML/XHTML source retrieved by HTTP GET request to be stored in the cache and pulled from that cache for any subsequent GET requests to the same url, as long as caching is enabled; by default, caching is handled by the FileSystemCache, which stores files in a directory called "jaunt_cache", which is in the directory specified by UserAgentSettings.outputPath.

        a referece to this UserAgent.
        Throws:
        CacheException

        Parameters:

        handler - an object that implements the Handler interface for handling the response content.
        Returns:
        a reference to this UserAgent.

      • addBasicAuthenticator

        public UserAgent addBasicAuthenticator(String realmName,
                              String userId,
                              String password)
        Adds a BasicAuthenticator to the collection of BasicAuthenticators. When an authenticator is added, it must specify a realm but may or may not specify the protected directory. Every time a request is sent, the UserAgent searches for authenticators that match the (protected directory) of the request. If found, the authenticator is used to send a pre-emptive authentication header. If no pre-emptive authentication header is sent, the server will ask for one with the www-authenticate header, which the userAgent looks for in all replies from the server. if the header is detected, the UserAgent finds the authenticator with the matching realm, update's that authenticator's protected-directory setting, and re-sends the request with the authenticator's username & password, ie with header Authentication: Basic <username:password^gt;, where <> denotes base64 encoding. The next time a request is sent to the domain, the authorization should be pre-emtive since the protected-directory is now set in the authenticator.
        Parameters:
        realmName - the string that will be shown when the browser pops up the login window, eg - "Please enter your username and password for [realm name]"
        Returns:
        a reference to this UserAgent.

      • addBasicAuthenticator

        public UserAgent addBasicAuthenticator(String realmName,
                              String protectedDir,
                              String userId,
                              String password)
        Adds a BasicAuthenticator to the collection of BasicAuthenticators. When an authenticator is added, it must specify a realm but may or may not specify the protected directory. Every time a request is sent, the UserAgent searches for authenticators that match the (protected directory) of the request. If found, the authenticator is used to send a pre-emptive authentication header. If no pre-emptive authentication header is sent, the server will ask for one with the www-authenticate header, which the userAgent looks for in all replies from the server. if the header is detected, the UserAgent finds the authenticator with the matching realm, update's that authenticator's protected-directory setting, and re-sends the request with the authenticator's username & password, ie with header Authentication: Basic <username:password^gt;, where <> denotes base64 encoding. The next time a request is sent to the domain, the authorization should be pre-emtive since the protected-directory is now set in the authenticator.
        Parameters:
        protectedDir - is an absolute url to the protected directory.
        realmName - the string that will be shown when the browser pops up the login window, eg - "Please enter your username and password for [realm name]"
        Returns:
        a referece to this UserAgent.

      • removeBasicAuthenticators

        public int removeBasicAuthenticators(String realmName)
        Removes any basic authenticators associated with the specified realmName.
        Returns:
        the number of basic authenticators that were removed.

      • open

        public Document open(File file)
              throws IOException,
                     ResponseException
        Parses the HTML/XHTML/XML within the specified File, and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method).
        Returns:
        a reference to the Document.
        Throws:
        ResponseException - may occur if the document contains a meta tag that redirects to a url that results in the ResponseException.
        IOException

      • open

        public Document open(File file,
            String documentUrl)
              throws IOException,
                     ResponseException
        Parses the HTML/XHTML/XML within the specified File, and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method).
        Parameters:
        documentUrl - the url of the content in the specified file, used to convert relative/implicit urls in the document to absolute urls; if null, relative urls are not converted.
        Returns:
        a reference to the Document.
        Throws:
        ResponseException - may occur if the document contains a meta tag that redirects to a url that results in the ResponseException.
        IOException

      • openContent

        public Document openContent(String content)
                     throws ResponseException
        Parses the source HTML, XHTML, or XML and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method). A ResponseException can be thrown if the document autoredirects to a url.
        Parameters:
        content - the HTML, XHTML, or XML content.
        Returns:
        a Document.
        Throws:
        ResponseException
        See Also:
        parse(String)

      • openContent

        public Document openContent(String content,
                   String documentUrl)
                     throws ResponseException
        Parses the source HTML, XHTML, or XML and creates UserAgent.doc to represent the Document (which is also returned by this method). A ResponseException can be thrown if the document autoredirects to a url.
        Parameters:
        content - the HTML, XHTML, or XML content.
        documentUrl - the url of the specified content, used to convert relative/implicit urls in the document to absolute urls; if null, relative urls are not converted.
        Returns:
        a Document.
        Throws:
        ResponseException
        See Also:
        parse(String)

              throws ResponseException
        Sends the specified HttpRequest (GET, POST, HEAD, DELETE, or PUT)
        Returns:
        a Document or null if the response was successful but there was no content body (eg, HEAD request or 204 response).
        Throws:
        ResponseException

      • visit

        public Document visit(String url)
               throws ResponseException
        Directs the UserAgent to visit the specified url (ie, sends an HTTP GET request); UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).
        Returns:
        a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
        Throws:
        ResponseException

      • visit

        public Document visit(String url,
             int redirectCount)
               throws ResponseException
        Directs the UserAgent to visit the specified url (ie, to send an HTTP GET request); UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).
        Parameters:
        redirectCount - the number of consecutive redirections that occured immediately before this request.
        Returns:
        a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
        Throws:
        ResponseException

        public Document sendGET(String url)
                 throws ResponseException

      • sendGET

        public Document sendGET(String url,
               String... additionalHeaders)
                 throws ResponseException
        Sends an HTTP GET request for the specified url; UserAgent.doc is created to represent the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML Document (which is also returned by this method); UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse (the response headers and other response-related information).
        Parameters:
        additionalHeaders - each String must contain a header name followed by a colon followed by the header value (these headers are added-to or override the auto-managed headers [eg cookies, referer, etc] as well as the headers specified in UserAgent.settings.defaultRequestHeaders); can be null
        Returns:
        a Document object representing the retrieved HTML/XML/XHTML content.
        Throws:
        ResponseException
        See Also:
        visit(String)

            File downloadFile)
              throws ResponseException
        Downloads and saves the content at the specified url as the specified File, overwriting the file if it already exists; this method does not invoke the parser, and therefore UserAgent.doc is set to an empty Document; UserAgent.response is created to represent the HttpResponse.
        Throws:
        ResponseException
